result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Oneal Hills

records.addlTxt: State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties advise case remains on for trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert appeared by video for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held.  Defendant filed prompt disposition. Case set for jury trial and final pretrial dates. Court orders motions in limine filed by 10/26/22 end of business day. Witness lists and any other documents be filed and discovery cut off by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 4. Case remains set for 10/31 scheduling conference. State to have defendant produced from CJF.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition Received 10-10-22. - expiration date:2/6/2023

Defendant has another case 22CF2845 and filed a request for Prompt Disposition on both cases; parties requested earlier status conference date. Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04; Attorney Eugene E Detert to appear by zoom. Both parties agreed to date and time, via email. Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Schott.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court in person for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness subpoenaed but not present. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Court acknowledges the motion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State V Lee hearing. Matter set for preliminary hearing. Court finds good cause to extend preliminary hearing deadline.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. States requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills in court by video, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Adjourn the Preliminary Hearing.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
